intro: Gumira nitida, commonly known as the slender gumira, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Gumira nitida is often found in shaded, moist habitats such as forest understories.
